newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Fokker declines comment on Samsung talk.
newsitem.headline: Fokker declines comment on Samsung talk.

text.p: Bankrupt planemaker Fokker NV refused to confirm newspaper reports on Tuesday that Samsung Aerospace Industries had issued a letter of intent to take over the company.

"We will not give any detail on the subject," a Fokker spokeswoman said, adding that the firm was sticking to last Friday's press release when it announced Samsung was carrying out an exclusive due diligence at the Dutch firm.
The Financial Times reported on Tuesday morning that the rescue of Fokker grew more likely on Monday when Samsung Aerospace Industries said it had issued a letter of intent.
Dutch daily de Volkskrant said on Tuesday Samsung was willing to pay $130-$150 million for Fokker.
